caption.title: Selected clinical trials on prevention and treatment of COVID-19 with licensed drugs or substances under clinical development* 1

tr.td: Prevention, placebo-controlled trial (1:1 randomization) Participants: Employees in a health care facility or other persons at high risk of infection, e.g., relatives of patients with COVID-19 Treatment: Placebo or 10 mg chloroquine base/kg, thereafter 250 mg chloroquine phosphate daily for 3 months

Open trial Participants: Patients with positive COVID-19 test result Treatment: 800 mg darunavir (plus 150 mg cobicistat as booster) for 7 days together with chloroquine; contacts receive 1 g chloroquine phosphate on days 1 and 2, 0.5 g on day 3
Spain (Catalonia) Department of Health, Generalitat de Catalunya
Open trial, pilot study Participants: Patients with pneumonia from SARS-CoV-2 Treatment: 400 mg hydroxychloroquine daily for 5 days

Placebo-controlled double-blind trial (1:1 randomization) Participants: Moderately to severely ill patients with PCR-confirmed COVID-19, max. 12 days since disease onset; oxygen saturation SaO 2 /SpO 2 ≤ 94% at time of admission Treatment: 200 mg remdesivir i.v. on day 1, then 100 mg daily for a total of 9 days Comment: A similarly designed trial is being carried out simultaneously in 308 patients with mild symptoms.

Open trial, comparison with standard treatment Participants: Severely ill patients with PCR-confirmed COVID-19 (max. 4 days since diagnosis); oxygen saturation SaO 2 /SpO 2 ≤ 94% at time of admission; radiological demonstration of pulmonary infiltrates Treatment: 200 mg remdesivir i.v. on day 1, then 100 mg daily for a total of 5 or 10 days Comment: A similarly designed trial is being carried out simultaneously in 600 patients with moderate symptoms (SpO 2 >94%)

Open randomized trial Participants: Patients with PCR-confirmed COVID-19 and demonstration of pneumonia on CT Treatment (four groups): a) Symptomatic standard treatment b) Plus umifenovir* 2 3 × 200 mg/day for 2 weeks c) Plus oseltamivir 2 × 75 mg/day for 2 weeks d) Plus lopinavir/ritonavir 2 × 500 mg/day for 2 weeks

Placebo-controlled double-blind trial Participants: Patients with PCR-confirmed COVID-19 (max. 8 days since diagnosis); pulmonary findings on imaging Treatment: 1 × 100 mg thalidomide or placebo daily for 14 days
Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University

Pilot study, open design Participants: Patients with PCR-confirmed diagnosis, oxygen saturation ≤ 93% Treatment: 12 patients with 2 × 0.4 mg/kg recombinant human ACE2 i.v. daily, max. 7 days 12 patients with standard treatment
First Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University

table-wrap-foot.p: * 1 Altogether, >80 trials have been registered at www.clinicaltrials.gov; * 2 designation in some studies registered at www.clinicaltrials.gov: abidol/arbidol
ACE2, Angiotensin-converting enzyme 2; CT, computed tomography; i.v., intravenous; PCR, polymerase chain reaction; rh, recombinant human
